relation: From Mother. I tried to preserve the original colours on this one so I added a blue glow around the pink ghost.

There's something undeniably creepy about the Ghost of Starman, what with that glowing aura around the dark palette of its body. Having recently read the Alex Ross masterpiece "Marvels", I'd REALLY loved how he painted Cyclops's visor and tried to borrow a bit of that from memory, here. This is one of my favorite pieces of mine to date, just because it's fairly simple, yet I feel, so very effective.
The Ghost of Starman, visor all aglow.

Using my rusty-background Starman as a starting point, Z-Row decied to make a Ghost of Starman picture. That had given me an idea, so I did some color re-working, a little editing and added in that disting fushia-ish glow, and this was the result. Thanks again for the idea, Z!
